Log On Act

HB 3-081

Author: Westray

12 Sept 2023

Opening Declaration

  1. Each MP serves a 6 month term (excluding those appointed or elected through prorated contexts such as by-elections). In these 6 month terms, there is currently zero obligation for MPs to log on or participate in Harlonian society.
  2. MPs and Senators should be present ingame in order to understand the issues that regular players face, and to serve as role models to inspire future politicians.
  3. This matter is increasingly relevant to the current parliament, as some MPs haven’t logged onto Harlon City Server since they were first elected back in April.  

Information

  1. Members of the House of Assembly (also known as MPs) must log onto the server at least once every two months. If they do not log on, and cannot provide an excused absence in advance, then they are removed from office.
  2. Members of the Senate (also known as Senators) must log onto the server at least once every three months. If they do not log on, and cannot provide an excused absence in advance, then the Senator will be automatically  placed under review by the Crown.
  1. The Crown will be obligated to review the Senator’s activity. In accordance with the constitution, it will be entirely up to the Crown’s discretion as to if they wish to remove or keep the Senator.

Implementation and timeline

  1. This act will be enforced upon the next term (October - April, 2023)

Other Information

  1. N/A
